results.title: Wildflowers of Australia: Flowers and Their Habitats
results.creator_credit: EVP Television, Ross Wurst and Joyce Haynes
results.brief_description: A video panorama of native flora from the wetlands, woodlands, grasslands, arid and coastal heathlands of Australia. The wildflowers presented in this video have been filmed on location across Australia, over a period of many years, and in many cases have been difficult to identify.
results.title_for_label: Wildflowers of Australia: Flowers and Their Habitats

results.title: Wildfire!
results.creator_credit: Jeff Myrow, Ronox Productions and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: The tragic saga of the Wenatchee forest fire, one of history’s worst, and the heroic efforts to combat it, is documented hour-by-hour and day-by-day. 8,500 fire fighters faced the flames and dense smoke for 16 days, and bulldozers, aeroplanes and helicopters were also used. Finally there is silence and stillness, after decimation of hundreds of years’ growth.

results.title: Wildfire
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Victoria. Forests Commission
results.brief_description: Bushfires, an annual hazard in Australia, destroy many thousands of hectares of bushland each year. This film traces the progress of a fire from start to finish though the eyes of the men who fight the fires and those who plan firefighting strategy. Also examines the controversy surrounding the claim that fire is necessary for the survival of the bush. Suitable for middle and upper primary and secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dione Gilmour, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Victoria. Forests Commission

results.title: Wildest Antarctica
results.creator_credit: Grainger Television Australia and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: Using footage shot during five expeditions, Wildest Antarctica stunningly documents the fragile beauty of this extraordinary continent. Despite increased awareness of the environment in recent years, Antarctica and its inhabitants are still under threat from the effects of global warming. This documentary examines the current state of the continent, and examines the day-to-day lives of the wild creatures that roam its vast expanse. Penguin breeds discussed in detail include Adelie, Chinstrap, Gentoo, Emperor, Royal, Rockhopper, and Magellanic. Seals, whales, dolphins, and sea birds, and their fight for survival against pollution and predation, are also documented.

results.title: Wilderness: The Himalayas
results.creator_credit: Ned Kelly, Time-Life Films and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Narrator Anthony Smith journeys from India to Tibet along an ancient foot highway which unites the two countries. Highlights the fauna, flora and people en route. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Wilderness is not a place
results.brief_description: The title of this film is taken from an essay by J. A. Baker. The film like the essay, pleads for the spirit of the wilderness which exists in an estuary. It claims to show the aesthetic values of estuaries as well as their value to birdlife. The film was made as a reply to the claim that “the siting of London third airport at Foulness is a victory for conservation”.

results.title: Wilder's 'The Long Christmas dinner'
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Larry Yust
results.brief_description: Interviewed on the set of the film version of Thornton Wilder’s play ‘The long christmas dinner’, the principal players in this film are asked to compare the advantages and disadvantages of acting for film and for the stage. Although not all the actors interviewed agreed, most concur that acting for film presents a special challenge. Cast includes David Soul and Andrew Robinson.

results.title: Wilde's domain
results.creator_credit: Peter Benardos, Charles Tingwell and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: This film follows the drama of an Australian entertainment family, the Wildes. Kit Taylor and June Salter star as mother and son with a domain that stretches beyond the circus tent, encompassing the theatre, a wild animal park and the boardroom jungle. The future of the family seems stable, with the children being groomed to assume a position in the entertainment business. Their future is threatened by an unsavoury affair and a visiting Russian ballet troupe. Also starring Martin Vaughan, Lenore Smith, Warwick Moss, Alan Lee and Ivar Kantis.

results.title: Wildcats and white horses
results.brief_description: The search for oil under the sea in Bass Strait, showing preliminary survey methods, then test drilling, with a detailed account of the operation of the floating rig Glomar III, and the successful well Marlin A-one.
